conclusion: Given a transverse harmonic wave propagating along the x-axis, with A=10 cm in both figures. Figure 1 shows the waveform at t=2s, and Figure 2 shows the vibration image of the particle at the abscissa x=2m.
Figure 1 depicts a wave at time t=2 seconds with amplitude A=10 cm.
Figure 2 illustrates a wave at position x=2 meters with the same amplitude.

premise: In Figure 1, the wave is moving from left to right.
conclusion: The wave is propagating along the x-axis from left to right.
The formula for wave speed is v = 位/T, where 位 is the wavelength and T is the period.

premise: From Figure 1, the wavelength is 位 = 4 cm.

conclusion: The period T is 2 seconds, as given.

premise: Substitute the values into the wave speed formula: v = 4 cm / 2 s.
conclusion: The wave speed v is 2 cm/s.

premise: Convert the wave speed from cm/s to m/s: v = 2 cm/s.
conclusion: The wave speed v is 2 x 10^-2 m/s.
